Posts.Content:
Thank you. I am relieved to have received a good report card. Yeah!!! one less thing for me to worry about
. Simplistic007
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Stage I

Posts.Content: Please try not to be anxious. I know it is easier said than done. I was diagnosed with breast cancer (left) breast in 2008. I went in for a mammo and they found cluster microcalcifications. They did the biopsy and it came back Stage I cancer. I had radiation treatment and so far I have been cancer free for 1 year. I go again in 6 months for retesting. I understand your concern. When I had my biopsy it took them almost 3 weeks to get back to me as to whether it was cancer or not. It was a nightmare waiting all this time and worrying did not help me at all. I am hopeful that you will be okay. Please keep us posted. Keep your faith as when these things happen, the best thing is to pray and always keep your faith.
Posts.Title: Small cluster of microcalcification

Posts.Content:
To all my forum friends. I had my biopsy yesterday and just went to the doctor for a follow up today. Bandage changes and I am cancer free. Pathology report came back benign. I am good. Thank God. Praise the Lord. Woo Hooot!!! Thank you all for your support and kindness.
Simplistic007
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Stage I

Posts.Content: Thank you Bev. You are right peace of mind is the best.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Stage I

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with breast cancer, Stage I in 2008. I was very lucky to have had it caught so early.  I had radiation treatment for almost 2 months. I got my year mammo back in June and they stated that there was some scar tissue or they thought it was scar tissue due to the radiation, and to follow up in 6 months. I just went for my 6 month check up and the scar tissue is still there. According to radiologist it shouldn't really be there so he is recommending a stereotactic biopsy to confirm what it is that he sees.  He wants to make sure it is scar tissue and not a growing tumor.  I am a bit nervous.  Has anyone had a stereotactic biopsy. What should I expect?  One of the symptoms I had before I was diagnosed with breast cancer was itchyness.  I am scared because my breast is itchy again and it scares me a lot.  Anyone has any input or any itching and had breast cancer?  Thank you.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Stage I

Posts.Content:
Bev,
I had the same thing told to me by physicians, that itchiness had nothing to do with diagnosis. I disagree. I believe itchiness has a lot to do with diagnosis. Before I was diagnosed with BC, I lived in Boston and I continually complained of itchiness and burning on the left breast. Docs kept telling me it's due to exercise not anything to worry about
. Even my mammo showed calcification and I continued to complain about
 itchiness and swelling and burning, they continued to tell me nothing. When I moved to FL I went in for my routine mammo and they found calcification and the doc in Florida decided to biopsied. Well guess what? I had Stage I cancer and I knew it because I know my body and I just knew that was not normal. After my biopsy and treatment, the itchiness, burning and irritation stopped. After almost 2 years after treatment, I am experiencing some itchiness again so now I am not sure if this is due to the healing process post radiation or if something is going on. My doc does not think it is back but she is going to compare all xrays and let me know if it could be the pins I have in the breast to note the area of radiation that could possibly be irritating me this time. Bottomline, you know your body and I knew back then when I was itchy and burning that this was not normal. Thank God I moved and my new doc found the breast cancer early enough to save my breast too. Amen!!!
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Stage I

Posts.Content:
Bev,
Thank you for your time. As of today, I am still waiting to hear from my General Surgeon as how she will address this. She did review my old films and new films and is waiting to hear from Radiologists to find out if I need to have the pins removed and re-biopsied to be safe. Waiting gets pretty anxious, but just have to wait and see. i will keep you posted.
God Bless.
Simplistic007
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Stage I

Posts.Content:
Heads up! I went in today for my MRI results although nothing was clear as to whether there is a problem or possible problem at all. My General Surgeon and I decided that we are going to go through the biopsy of the left breast and remove the clips and reexamine the cells in that area. That is the area that the MRI and Radiologists cannot detect as completely clear because of the possibility that it could and could not be. No guessing on this. My biopsy will be in February. This will give me peace of mind. I am content with this. Thank you all for listening and being there for me. God Bless U.
xxoo

Posts.Content:
MrsChorlton, No news yet. I go in tomorrow for the lumpectomy. As soon as I hear, I will let you know. thank you for your concern and support.

Posts.Content:
Bev,
Thank you. Yes it does. Did it take you a week or so to recover from DNC or was it just a couple of days? I hear sometimes it takes a week to feel good again. Very painful procedure.
Posts.Title: Tomaxefin and DNC's

Posts.Content: I am a Stage I breast cancer survivor. I am currently taking Tomaxefin and have had no side effects. I have been on the medication a little over a year now. I am 44 yrs. old and so far no weight gain that I can blame on the Tomaxefin and no hot flashes. I was very fearful of what if would get bad side effects, but I am so happy I have not. Good Luck, give it a shot and see what happens. You can always stop it if necessary.
Posts.Title: Tomaxifen as continuing treatment

Posts.Content:
Nicckey76
I just read your posting and i am so sorry to hear about
 all you are going through. I had Stage I breast cancer and suffer FM. I have a very good friend of mine who is only 26 years old and she has Lupus. She was hospitalized in August of 2010 and almost lost her life. She was in remission for 10 years, but thank God she is much better now. Is there a reason why you decided to not do reconstruction surgery? is it because your body will not be able to handle due to SLE? I am just curious because I know that this is a tough decisioon to make. I also know of someone who was diagnosed with MS at the age of 19 and then later in life breast cancer. She opted out of reconstruction surgery because the doctors recommended that her body will not be able to handle it due to her MS. My thoughts and prayers are with you. keep up in touch with your progress. I am glad you are in this forum. 
simplistic007
Posts.Title: I am 33 with Breast Cancer and Lupus

Posts.Content: thank you so much for the input.  yes, I do have a General Surgeon. I don't see her till Jan 7th because she is on vacation and I just went the 22nd of Dec for the follow up mammo.  I am sure she will either say go for the biopsy or I will do the biopsy myself. I trust her fully as she is an unbelievable physician so whatever she decides whether surgical biopsy or stereotactic biopsy I will do. i am sure she will do one or the other.  Have a wonderful Holiday and thank you for the input.
Posts.Title: Thank you

Posts.Content: Can anyone tell me if they have to go through a DNC because the tomaxefin is causing endrometriosis polyps?  I have been experiencing heavy and very painful periods.  I have not had any skipped ones, but saw my OBGYN and had an ultrasound done and found polyps on the uterus. He recommended a DNC to clean me up and make sure there not cancerous or pre cancerous.  He did mention that people who have to take Tomaxefin have a risk of experiencing this side effect because of the lack of estrogen.  I guess it fixes one thing and damages another.  Breast Cancer State I survivor. Taking Tomaxefin for the next 3 years.  2 years on it already.
Posts.Title: Tomaxefin and DNC's

Posts.Content: Thank you for the input. I appreciate it.

I never had symptoms either. I just hope she sees a doctor soon. This is something not to wait or be stubborn about
. This is much too serious. She is still very young. Hopefully she is not ready to die as of yet. In her 50's is not old. Good Luck....
